alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Jones; Monroe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 04 at 9:42PM EDT until September 05 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bibb County in central Georgia... Southwestern Jones County in central Georgia... Southeastern Monroe County in central Georgia... * Until 345 AM EDT Monday. * At 942 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by training of thunderstorms and locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Macon, Payne, Payne City, Wesleyan, Arkwright, Lake Tobesofkee, Bolingbroke, Lizella, Skipperton, Cross Keys, Rutland, Dames Ferry, Middle Georgia Regional Airport, Franklinton and Plant Scherer. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
